meanings.definition: The position or role of being an elder.
meanings.sent1: In our community, the eldership is highly respected for their wisdom.
meanings.sent2: The eldership in the village council meets every month to discuss important matters.
meanings.sent3: The eldership decided to have a dance-off to determine the best dancer among them.
meanings.sent4: Her eldership in the family was like a guiding light, always showing the way.
meanings.sent5: The eldership of the tribe was passed down through generations, symbolizing continuity and tradition.

meanings.definition: The collective body of elders in a group or organization.
meanings.sent1: The eldership gathered to make a decision on behalf of the community.
meanings.sent2: Being part of the eldership means taking on important responsibilities.
meanings.sent3: The eldership held a bake sale to raise funds for a new community center.
meanings.sent4: The eldership of the company worked together to navigate through challenging times.
meanings.sent5: The eldership of the church provided guidance and support to the congregation.
